revisions.rev:
{{Infobox award | name = Upper Midwest Emmy Award | image = | imagesize = | caption = Upper Midwest Emmy Award | description = Excellence in [[television]] | presenter = [[National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences|NATAS]] | State = [[Minnesota]] | year = 1973 | website = http://midwestemmys.org/ }}
The '''Upper Midwest Emmy Awards''' are a division of the [[National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences]]. The [[Minnesota]] division was founded in 1973. In addition to granting the Upper Midwest [[Emmy Awards]], this division awards scholarships, honors industry veterans at the Silver Circle Celebration, conducts National Student Television Awards of Excellence, has a free research and a nationwide job bank. The chapter also participates in judging Emmy entries at the regional and national levels.<ref name="urlScholarship Recipients - National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences">{{cite web |url=http://midwestemmys.org/category/scholarship-recipients/ |title=Scholarship Recipients - National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}}Scholarship Program</ref>
==Boundaries==
The academy is divided into the following boundaries and encompasses the states of [[Minnesota]], [[North Dakota]], [[South Dakota]], parts of [[Nebraska]] and [[Wisconsin]]. These boundaries are responsible for the submission of television broadcast materials presented for awards considerations.<ref name="urlAbout - National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences">{{cite web |url=http://midwestemmys.org/about/ |title=About - National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}}Boundaries</ref>
==Board of directors==
The Board of Governors is a working board which work together collaboratively to ensures the best interests of the membership.<ref name="urlmidwestemmys.org">{{cite web |url=http://midwestemmys.org/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/2009-NATAS-UM-Fact-Sheet-FINAL.pdf |title=midwestemmys.org |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}}Board of Directors</ref>

==Emmy award winners==
Emmy award winners are individuals who show excellence in the field of television. The Emmys are held to the same esteem as the [[Oscar Awards]] are to motion pictures or the [[Grammy Awards]] are to the music industry.<ref name="url2009 Regional Emmy Award Winners - National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences">{{cite web |url=http://midwestemmys.org/2010/01/22/emmy-night-2009-2/ |title=2009 Regional Emmy Award Winners - National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}}Emmy Award Winners</ref>
